NEW PAGE 36
Draft #7
ZONING ORDINANCE
Chapter 4 District Regulations
Section 4-12. Notes to Table of Permitted Uses Development Standards
The Development Standards in these Notes provide regulations and conditions must be verified by the
Zoning Administrator in order for a zoning permit to be issued. The purpose of these conditions is to
assure that certain uses which may have complexity, or are potentially incompatible with their
surroundings, meet the specified restrictions. Each use with required development standards shall
comply with the regulations of the district in which it is located and with the requirements specified in
these Notes.
Note 1. Accessory Uses and Structures - In residential districts
a. Accessory structures shall be located in a rear yard not less than five (5) feet from the
rearlot line. The side yard setback shall be the same as for the side yard setback for the
districtwhere located, provided that in no case shall the structure be located within
20 feet of any street right-of-way.
b. Structures except for utility substations or similar structures shall not be located
within any easement.
C. Separate structures must be located a minimum of 10 feet away from the principal
building.
d. Such structures shall cover not more than thirty percent (30%) of the rear yard.
e. Built-in swimming pools are not considered accessory structures.
Note 2. Bed and Breakfast), Air B and B
a. A Bed and Breakfast home (B and B) or Air B and B shall not be located within four
hundred (400) feet of a rooming house, boarding house or another tourist/guest
home.
b. The B and B or Air B and B must be owned by the property owner who also resides
onthe property.
C.
The use shall be located in a structure which was originally constructed as a
dwelling.
d. Meals served on the premise shall be for guests of the facility.
e. There shall be no exterior advertising except that which is permitted for a home
occupation.
Note 3. Churches
a. A Church or other place of worship may be allowed in a Residential District subject
to the requirements of the district where it is located and provided that the
structure shallhave minimum side and rear yards of fifty (50) feet and a front yard
at least twenty-five (25) feet greater than that required for a single-family
residence within the district, andthat the off-street parking requirement of this
ordinance are met.
b. An outdoor play area for a church in any zoning district shall be enclosed by a
Village of Alamance Zoning Ordinance

NEW PAGE 36
Draft #7
ZONING ORDINANCE
Chapter 4 District Regulations
Section 4-12. Notes to Table of Permitted Uses Development Standards
The Development Standards in these Notes provide regulations and conditions must be verified by the
Zoning Administrator in order for a zoning permit to be issued. The purpose of these conditions is to
assure that certain uses which may have complexity, or are potentially incompatible with their
surroundings, meet the specified restrictions. Each use with required development standards shall
comply with the regulations of the district in which it is located and with the requirements specified in
these Notes.
Note 1. Accessory Uses and Structures - In residential districts
a. Accessory structures shall be located in a rear yard not less than five (5) feet from the
rearlot line. The side yard setback shall be the same as for the side yard setback for the
districtwhere located, provided that in no case shall the structure be located within
20 feet of any street right-of-way.
b. Structures except for utility substations or similar structures shall not be located
within any easement.
C. Separate structures must be located a minimum of 10 feet away from the principal
building.
d. Such structures shall cover not more than thirty percent (30%) of the rear yard.
e. Built-in swimming pools are not considered accessory structures.
Note 2. Bed and Breakfast), Air B and B
a. A Bed and Breakfast home (B and B) or Air B and B shall not be located within four
hundred (400) feet of a rooming house, boarding house or another tourist/guest
home.
b. The B and B or Air B and B must be owned by the property owner who also resides
onthe property.
C.
The use shall be located in a structure which was originally constructed as a
dwelling.
d. Meals served on the premise shall be for guests of the facility.
e. There shall be no exterior advertising except that which is permitted for a home
occupation.
Note 3. Churches
a. A Church or other place of worship may be allowed in a Residential District subject
to the requirements of the district where it is located and provided that the
structure shallhave minimum side and rear yards of fifty (50) feet and a front yard
at least twenty-five (25) feet greater than that required for a single-family
residence within the district, andthat the off-street parking requirement of this
ordinance are met.
b. An outdoor play area for a church in any zoning district shall be enclosed by a
Village of Alamance Zoning Ordinance
Page 34

NEW PAGE 37
Draft #7
ZONING ORDINANCE
Chapter 4 District Regulations
Section 4-12. Notes to Table of Permitted Uses Development Standards
fence or other protection. The height shall be a minimum of four feet and the
top of the fence shall be free of protrusions. The fencing shall exclude fixed
bodies of water such as ditches, quarries, canals, excavations, and fish ponds.
Gates to the fencedoutdoor play area shall remain securely closed while children
occupy the area.
Note 4. Construction Office Manufactured Home Class A or B, Temporary
A manufactured home type structure (Class A or B) may be temporarily permitted in
the MU and I districts as a construction office on the same lot in which a building is
being erected until the certificate of occupancy has been issued. Such structures shall
comply with the front and side yard requirements of the district and shall be moved off
the lot before or immediately upon issuance of the Certificate of Occupancy for the
building being constructed.
Note 5. Dwelling, manufactured Home, Class A/B, Located on a Lot in RM District
a. Every manufactured home located in the R-M Residential-Manufactured Home
District shall be located on the lot with the long dimension of the manufactured home
parallel tothe street right-of-way on which the lot fronts.
b. In no case shall a manufactured home be located less than 35 feet from the street
right-of-way on which a lot fronts.
Note 6. Dwelling, manufactured home, Class A or B, located on bona fide farm on same
tractof land with an existing residential structure or other principal use
A manufactured home located on a bona fide farm (RA District) may be placed on the
same tract of land as the original residential structure if it meets the following
conditions:
a. the manufactured home shall be occupied only by the children, parents, brothers,
or sisters of the legal owner of the farm;
b.
the manufactured home shall be the full-time, permanent residence of the children,
parents, brothers, or sisters inhabiting the structure;
C.
the manufactured home shall be located at least 500 feet from any adjoining tract
of land or public street;
d. a vegetative screen, natural or planted, shall be maintained on the farm to screen
the home from residential development located on adjoining tracts;
e.
a vegetative screen, natural or planted, shall be maintained on the farm to screen
the home from any public street located within 1,000 feet of the home;
f.
the manufactured home shall not be located closer than thirty (30) feet to an
existing residential structure located on the farm.
g.
If at any time in the future the manufactured home, its location, or its use as a
residence fails to meet any of the criteria listed within this ordinance, the
Village of Alamance Zoning Ordinance
